title: Create unified test runner script
description:
Create a single test runner that executes all validation tests:

Script: scripts/validate-deployment.sh

Usage:
  ./scripts/validate-deployment.sh local    # Test against localhost:3000
  ./scripts/validate-deployment.sh test     # Test against www.softwaremaniac.nl (requires auth)
  ./scripts/validate-deployment.sh prod     # Test against inspired-it.nl

Features:
- Run all tests in sequence
- Collect and report results
- Exit with appropriate code (0=pass, 1=fail)
- Color-coded output for pass/fail
- Summary at end showing which tests passed/failed

Tests to run:
1. Draft exclusion from blog overview
2. Draft exclusion from sitemap
3. Draft exclusion from RSS
4. Sitemap URL validation
5. RSS URL validation

Output example:
  Validating deployment: test (https://www.softwaremaniac.nl)
  ‚úì Drafts excluded from blog overview
  ‚úì Drafts excluded from sitemap
  ‚úì Drafts excluded from RSS
  ‚úì Sitemap URLs correct
  ‚úì RSS URLs correct
  
  All 5 tests passed!

title: Markdown conversion implemented 3 times
description: Three different implementations: blog.ts (markdown-it+plugins), markdown-converter/index.tsx (regex-based), generate-static-assets.js (basic markdown-it).

title: Create test script infrastructure
description:
Set up the test script infrastructure:
- Create scripts/test-deployment.sh or similar
- Accept environment parameter (local|test|prod)
- For test environment: read credentials from .env or secure location
- Use curl with -u flag for HTTP Basic Auth on softwaremaniac
- Return exit codes for CI integration

Credentials discovery:
- Check rclone config for existing credentials
- Or create .env.test file (gitignored) for test credentials
- Pattern: TEST_USER and TEST_PASS environment variables

title: Unhandled clipboard promise in markdown-converter
description: markdown-converter/index.tsx:115-120 - navigator.clipboard.writeText() has no .catch() handler. Shows 'Copied' even if access fails.

title: Create ThemeToggle component
description:
Create the theme selector dropdown component:

File: src/components/ThemeToggle.tsx

UI (matching screenshot):
- Dropdown button with current theme icon
- Three options:
  - ‚òÄÔ∏è Light theme
  - üåô Dark theme  
  - üñ•Ô∏è Device default

Behavior:
- Click button to open dropdown
- Click option to select and close
- Click outside to close
- Keyboard: Escape to close, arrow keys to navigate
- Current selection shown with checkmark or highlight

Accessibility:
- aria-expanded on button
- aria-haspopup='menu'
- role='menu' on dropdown

- Focus management

Styling:

- Dark mode aware (dropdown should look good in both modes)
- Smooth transitions

title: Hardcoded URLs duplicated across codebase
description: LinkedIn URL appears 8 times, GitHub URL 2 times across 5+ files. Should be centralized in config.

title: Test: Sitemap URLs match deployment environment
description:
Verify sitemap.xml URLs use the correct BASE_URL for each environment:

Expected URLs per environment:
- localhost: http://localhost:3000
- test: https://www.softwaremaniac.nl
- prod: https://inspired-it.nl

Test approach:
1. Fetch /sitemap.xml
2. Extract all <loc> URLs
3. Verify ALL URLs start with the expected base URL
4. Verify NO URLs contain wrong environment URLs (e.g., no inspired-it URLs on softwaremaniac)

Implementation:
- Accept environment parameter
- Map environment to expected BASE_URL
- Fetch sitemap, count URLs matching expected base
- Count URLs NOT matching (should be 0)
- Report mismatched URLs if found

title: Sitemap/RSS URLs are broken - date prefix not stripped
description: generate-static-assets.js:25 keeps date prefix in slug but blog.ts:156 strips it. All sitemap/RSS blog URLs return 404.
close_reason: Fixed: slug now strips date prefix to match blog.ts

title: Testing Epic: Blog, Sitemap & RSS Validation
description:
Comprehensive test suite to validate:
1. Draft posts are excluded from blog overview, sitemap, and RSS feed
2. URLs in sitemap and RSS match the deployment environment (localhost/softwaremaniac/inspired-it)
3. Authentication handling for password-protected test environment

This ensures content integrity and correct SEO across all deployment targets.

title: Test: Drafts excluded from sitemap.xml
description:
Verify draft posts are not listed in sitemap.xml:

Test approach:
1. Fetch /sitemap.xml
2. Parse XML and extract all <loc> URLs
3. Verify none of the URLs contain draft post slugs
4. Cross-reference with content/blog/*.md files that have publish_status: draft

Implementation:
- Use curl to fetch /sitemap.xml
- Use grep to find all blog URLs
- Compare against known draft slugs (mission-control, etc.)
- Exit 1 if any draft found

title: Test: Drafts excluded from RSS feed
description:
Verify draft posts are not listed in rss.xml:

Test approach:
1. Fetch /rss.xml
2. Parse XML and extract all <link> and <guid> URLs
3. Verify none contain draft post slugs
4. Cross-reference with content/blog/*.md files that have publish_status: draft

Implementation:
- Use curl to fetch /rss.xml
- Use grep to extract <link> elements
- Compare against known draft slugs
- Exit 1 if any draft found

title: Test: RSS feed URLs match deployment environment
description:
Verify rss.xml URLs use the correct BASE_URL for each environment:

Expected URLs per environment:
- localhost: http://localhost:3000
- test: https://www.softwaremaniac.nl  
- prod: https://inspired-it.nl

Test approach:
1. Fetch /rss.xml
2. Extract all absolute URLs (<link>, <guid>, atom:link href)
3. Verify ALL URLs start with the expected base URL
4. Verify NO URLs contain wrong environment URLs

Implementation:
- Accept environment parameter
- Map environment to expected BASE_URL
- Fetch RSS, extract all absolute URLs
- Validate each against expected base
- Report mismatched URLs if found

title: Implement HTTP Basic Auth for test environment
description:
Handle authentication for the password-protected test environment (www.softwaremaniac.nl):

Discovery:
- Site uses HTTP Basic Auth (WWW-Authenticate: Basic realm)

Implementation options (in order of preference):
1. **1Password CLI** (recommended - already on machine)
   - Use `op read` to fetch credentials at runtime
   - Example: `op read 'op://Vault/Softwaremaniac/username'`
   - No credentials stored in files or env vars
   - Requires 1Password CLI setup and sign-in

2. Read from environment variables (TEST_AUTH_USER, TEST_AUTH_PASS)

3. Read from .env.test file (must be gitignored)

4. Use curl --netrc with ~/.netrc file

Security requirements:
- NEVER commit credentials to git
- Prefer 1Password CLI for zero-credential-on-disk approach

1Password CLI setup:
- Install: brew install 1password-cli
- Sign in: op signin
- Test: op read 'op://VaultName/ItemName/field'

Script usage with 1Password:
```bash
USER=$(op read 'op://Vault/Softwaremaniac/username')
PASS=$(op read 'op://Vault/Softwaremaniac/password')  
curl -u "$USER:$PASS" https://www.softwaremaniac.nl/
```

title: Zero ARIA/accessibility attributes in codebase
description: No role= or aria- attributes anywhere. Form inputs lack labels, interactive elements lack accessible names.

title: Add FOUC prevention script
Configure Tailwind for dark mode
XSS vulnerability with dangerouslySetInnerHTML
description: Two locations use dangerouslySetInnerHTML without sanitization: src/pages/blog/[slug].tsx:91 and src/pages/admin/markdown-converter/index.tsx:177

title: Dark Mode Support
description:
Add dark mode support to the website with three theme options:
1. Light theme (sun icon)
2. Dark theme (moon icon)
3. Device default / System (monitor icon) - follows OS preference

Standard implementation approach:
- Tailwind: Enable `darkMode: 'class'` in tailwind.config.ts
- Toggle `dark` class on <html> element
- Use `dark:` prefix for dark variants (e.g., `bg-white dark:bg-gray-900`)
- Persist choice in localStorage
- Detect system preference via `prefers-color-scheme` media query
- Listen for system preference changes when 'system' is selected

UI Component: Theme selector dropdown (like the screenshot example)
- Three options with icons
- Accessible keyboard navigation
- Visual indicator of current selection

Reference examples:
- Tailwind docs: https://tailwindcss.com/docs/dark-mode
- Next.js themes: next-themes library (handles SSR hydration issues)

title: Blog mobile: hide search/tags in hamburger menu
description: On mobile, the blog search and tags section takes up too much vertical space at the top of the page, requiring users to scroll past it to see actual blog posts. Solution: hide search/tags in a collapsible hamburger menu on small screens.
close_reason: Implemented collapsible search/filter panel and hamburger menu for mobile

title: Create ThemeProvider context
description:
Create a React context to manage theme state:

File: src/contexts/ThemeContext.tsx

Features:
- Three theme options: 'light' | 'dark' | 'system'
- Persist selection in localStorage (key: 'theme')
- On mount: read localStorage or default to 'system'
- When 'system': listen to `matchMedia('(prefers-color-scheme: dark)')`
- Apply/remove 'dark' class on document.documentElement

Prevent flash of wrong theme (FOUC):
- Add inline script in _document.tsx to set class before React hydrates
- Script checks localStorage and system preference immediately

Interface:
```typescript
interface ThemeContextType {
  theme: 'light' | 'dark' | 'system';
  resolvedTheme: 'light' | 'dark';  // actual applied theme
  setTheme: (theme: 'light' | 'dark' | 'system') => void;
}
```

Alternative: Use next-themes library which handles all this + SSR edge cases.

title: Type assertion hides publish_status violation
description: blog.ts:176 assigns null to publish_status but interface only allows 'draft'|'published'|undefined. The 'as BlogPost' assertion masks this.

title: Missing Array.isArray check on tags
description: blog.ts:170 - 'tags: data.tags || []' doesn't verify tags is actually an array. Malformed frontmatter could cause issues.

title: Use of any types in blog/[slug].tsx
description: Lines 42-43 use 'any' type for post and relatedPosts props. Should use BlogPost interface from @/utils/blog.

title: Draft posts included in sitemap/RSS
description: generate-static-assets.js doesn't filter draft posts like blog.ts does. Draft post 2025-12-17-mission-control.md is in sitemap/RSS.
close_reason: Fixed: added filter to exclude draft posts

title: Test: Drafts excluded from blog overview
description:
Verify draft posts do not appear in the blog listing page:

Test approach:
1. Ensure at least one draft post exists (publish_status: draft in frontmatter)
2. Fetch /blog page
3. Parse HTML and extract all blog post links
4. Verify none of the links point to draft posts
5. Cross-reference with content/blog/*.md files that have publish_status: draft

Current draft: content/blog/2025-12-17-mission-control.md

Implementation:
- Use curl to fetch /blog
- Use grep/sed to extract hrefs
- Compare against known draft slugs
- Exit 1 if any draft found
